actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on November 19, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Hill moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 396
actions-list.actionItem: 6 (Roll no. 467).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 5658 — "To amend title 39, United States Code, to require mail-in ballots to use the Postal Service barcode service, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 389
actions-list.actionItem: 9 (Roll no. 466).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8371 — "To make certain improvements in the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8371.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8371 — "To make certain improvements in the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7653.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7653 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to update certain terminology regarding veteran employment."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2181.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 2181 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to repeal the sunset on entitlement to memorial headstones and markers for commemoration of veterans and certain individuals and to repeal the sunset on authority to bury remains of certain spouses and children in national cemeteries, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3126.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Bost moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3126 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to furnish or replace a headstone, marker, or medallion for the grave of an eligible Medal of Honor recipient regardless of the recipient's dates of service in the Armed Forces, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 825.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 825 — "To prohibit contracting with persons that have business operations with the Maduro regime, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5658.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Fry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5658 — "To amend title 39, United States Code, to require mail-in ballots to use the Postal Service barcode service, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5536.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fry moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5536 — "To require transparency in notices of funding opportunity, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of November 18.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable John S. Duarte to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
